byline.contributor: Rukmini Callimachi reported from New York and Paris, Alissa J. Rubin from Paris and Brussels, and Laure Fourquet from Paris. Aurelien Breeden and Milan Schreuer contributed reporting from Brussels, and Andrew Higgins from Paris.
byline.original: By RUKMINI CALLIMACHI, ALISSA J. RUBIN and LAURE FOURQUET

abstract: Information gathered by investigators of Paris terrorist attacks show Islamic State refined its tactics and relied on growing network of sympathizers to inflict widespread harm; arrest of Salah Abdeslam, believed to be main planner of Paris terrorist attacks, provides authorities opportunity to glean valuable information missed in days leading up to Paris incidents (Series: State of Terror).
lead_paragraph: A 55-page French report details how the attackers used disciplined communications, identified soft targets and perfected bomb-making techniques after two years of failures.

headline.main: A View of ISIS’s Evolution in New Details of Paris Attacks
headline.print_headline: Paris Attackers Refined Tactics to Inflict Harm

snippet: A 55-page French report details how the attackers used disciplined communications, identified soft targets and perfected bomb-making techniques after two years of failures.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
